thread.title: Man smuggles baby saltwater crocodile in his workboot from Darwin to Brisbane
thread.title_full: Man smuggles baby saltwater crocodile in his workboot from Darwin to Brisbane | Daily Mail Online

author: Leith Huffadine For Daily Mail Australia
title: Man smuggles baby saltwater crocodile in his workboot from Darwin to Brisbane
text:
35 shares 6
View
comments
A man has been fined $5,700 after transporting a tiny baby crocodile in his workboot on a flight from Darwin to Brisbane.
The 35-year old man from Hervey Bay, north of Brisbane, in Queensland, bought the croc from a crocodile park in the Northern Territory and placed the saltwater crocodile in his shoe before boarding the plane in December last year.
He was prosecuted in the Brisbane Magistrates Court by the Queensland Department of Environment and Heritage Protection (EHP) on Wednesday, the Brisbane Times reported.
The juvenile salt water crocodile was taken on a Darwin to Brisbane flight stashed inside a work boot
The flyer was fined $5700 and ordered to pay costs of $250 for the incident, after he was caught with the crocodile at Brisbane Airport on December 3 last year.
An EHP spokesman said an EHP wildlife officer and Australian Federal Police found the juvenile crocodile inside a cardboard container, which was in a work boot belonging to the man.
RELATED ARTICLES Previous 1 2 Next Disturbing moment a mother spider 'bursts' into a hundred... Please sir, may I have some more! Watch the adorable moment... Grey nurse shark undergoes surgery to remove painful... Share this article Share The spokesman said the court was told the crocodile was 'essentially harmless' when it went through the airport.
Saltwater crocodiles are documented to grow to 7 metres long and weigh up to 1000 kilograms, according to the Australian Government Department for the Environment.
Despite that, bringing the animal into Queensland without permission was an offence.
Possessing a native animal such as a saltwater crocodile without a permit was an offence in Queensland under the Nature Conservation Act with penalties up to $353,400 or two years imprisonment for an individual.
The man was caught with the juvenile crocodile at Brisbane Airport after a flight from Darwin
Fully grown male saltwater crocodiles have, in rare cases, grown up to 7m long and weighed up to 1000kg
The saltwater crocodile was placed inside a cardboard container in one of the mans workboots
